items.name: Phoenix Framework
items.description: A web development framework written in Elixir which implements the server-side Model View Controller (MVC) pattern.

items.name: SurfaceUI
items.description: A server-side rendering component library that allows developers to build rich interactive user-interfaces, writing minimal custom Javascript.

items.name: Plug
items.description: A specification and composable modules for web application components, enabling HTTP request handling.

items.name: Absinthe
items.description: A GraphQL toolkit for Elixir, an implementation of the GraphQL specification built to suit the language's capabilities and idiomatic style

items.name: Scenic
items.description: Scenic is an application framework written directly on the Elixir/Erlang/OTP stack. With it, you can build client-side applications that operate identically across all supported operating systems, including MacOS, Ubuntu, Nerves/Linux, and more.

items.name: LiveView Native
items.description: LiveView Native empowers developers to build native and web applications seamlessly with Phoenix.

items.name: Nx
items.description: A multi-dimensional tensors library with multi-staged compilation to the CPU/GPU.

items.name: Axon
items.description: Nx-powered Neural Networks for Elixir.

items.name: Bumblebee
items.description: Pre-trained Neural Network models in Axon and integration with Hugging Face models

items.name: Explorer
items.description: Explorer brings series (one-dimensional) and dataframes (two-dimensional) for fast data exploration to Elixir.

items.name: Scholar
items.description: Traditional machine learning tools built on top of Nx. Scholar implements several algorithms for classification, regression, clustering, dimensionality reduction, metrics, and preprocessing.

items.name: Nerves
items.description: A framework for building embedded software using Elixir, providing tools and libraries for hardware interfacing.

items.name: Ecto
items.description: A database wrapper and query generator for Elixir, providing a unified API for working with different databases.

items.name: ExUnit
items.description: The built-in testing framework for Elixir, providing a simple and powerful API for writing and running tests.

items.name: Wallaby
items.description: A browser automation tool for Elixir, allowing developers to simulate realistic user interactions.

items.name: GetText
items.description: An internationalization and localization library for Elixir, allowing easy translation and formatting of messages.

items.name: Elixir CLDR
items.description: A library for working with Unicode Common Locale Data Repository (CLDR) in Elixir applications.

items.name: Dialyzer
items.description: A static analysis tool for Erlang and other languages that compile to BEAM bytecode for the Erlang VM

items.name: Credo
items.description: A static code analysis tool for the Elixir language with a focus on teaching and code consistency.

items.name: Ash Framework
items.description: A declarative, resource-oriented application development framework for Elixir.

items.name: Oban
items.description: A robust job processing library for Elixir, providing background job processing with reliability and concurrency.

items.name: Exq
items.description: An Elixir library for job processing, utilizing Redis for managing job queues and worker processes.

items.name: ExDoc
items.description: A tool for generating HTML documentation for Elixir projects, transforming documentation into readable web pages.

items.name: LiveBook
items.description: A collaborative and interactive code notebook for Elixir, providing a rich environment for exploring and sharing code.

items.name: Telemetry
items.description: A lightweight library for dynamic dispatching of events, with a focus on metrics and instrumentation.
